message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is about improving recurrent neural network language models, which are commonly used in natural language processing tasks such as image captioning and machine translation. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes improvements to the reward augmented maximum likelihood approach, which is a machine learning technique, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves optimizing the model's performance metric, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The tasks of image captioning and machine translation involve processing visual data, which could be categorized under cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper uses recurrent neural networks, which are a type of neural network, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
